summary: Meta Platforms turns in strong first-quarter results and issue solid guidance . Chinese e-commerce companies accounted for about 11% of its revenue last year . The stock looks attractively valued at current levels . AI continues to power the company's strong revenue growth .  Meta once again turned in a great quarter that easily topped analyst expectations . Its Q1 revenue jumped 16% year over year, or 19% in constant currencies, to $42.31 billion . Earnings per share (EPS) surged 37% year on year to $6.43 .  Advertising revenue was up 16%, coming in at $41.4 billion . Revenue at Reality Labs, which is home to Meta's augmented reality headsets and smart glasses, fell 6% to $412 million . Operating income from its social media apps climbed 23% .  Family daily active people climbed by 6% year over year to 3.43 billion in March . Meta's newest app, Threads, continues to nicely grow its user base, reaching more than 350 million monthly active users . The company expects to introduce ads gradually to the platform and not have it be a contributor this year .  Mark Zuckerberg added that the company is performing well and that it is well positioned to navigate the current economic uncertainty . The company also significantly increased its full-year capital expenditures to a range of $64 billion to $72 billion .  Meta Platforms trades at a forward price-to-earnings (P/E) ratio of around 23 times based on 2025 analyst estimates . Given its strong revenue growth, that's an attractive valuation . I think the stock looks like an attractive long-term buy at current levels .  Randi Zuckerberg, a former director of market development and spokeswoman for Facebook and sister to Meta Platforms CEO Mark Zuckerberg, is a member of The Motley Fool's board of directors . After losing nearly $1 trillion in market value, Nvidia now trails Apple and Microsoft . Nvidia has a lot of tailwinds that could fuel growth throughout the remainder of the year . The technology sector has witnessed an abnormal level of interest compared to other industries . The AI theme can largely be traced to asmall concentration of megacap stocks known as the "Magnificent Seven"  As of May 1, Nvidia is the third-largest company in the world measured by market cap . The company's current market cap is nearly $1 trillion lower than peak levels seen in January . The first large-scale sell-off in Nvidia stock happened earlier this year, after a Chinese start-up emerged out of nowhere .  The current sell-off in Nvidia revolves around a nasty storm related to new tariff policies . I see Nvidia as a more critical player to the development of AI-powered services compared to Apple and Microsoft .  As of closing bell on April 30, Microsoft, Meta Platforms, and Alphabet -- each of which works closely with Nvidia -- have reported earnings . Despite a turbulent macroeconomic environment, big tech appears to be confident in the long-run potential of AI .  Nvidia is best positioned among the Magnificent Seven to benefit from AI capex tailwinds . Tech giants are spending tens of billions on data centers, servers, chips, networking equipment, and more . Nvidia should witness strong demand for its GPUs and various other services throughout the second half of the year .  Nvidia: If you invested $1,000 when we doubled down in 2009,you’d have $296,928! The Motley Fool recommends the following options: long January 2026 $395 calls on Microsoft . Amazon, Apple, Microsoft, Nvidia, and Tesla are among the "Magnificent Seven" stocks .

"Magnificent Seven" stocks Amazon, Meta Platforms, and Nvidia remain great long-term picks . Vertex Pharmaceuticals' impressive momentum should continue with new drugs on the market and a promising pipeline . Amazon's share price remains more than 20% below its previous high .  Amazon Web Services leads the cloud services market and should enjoy a massive tailwind from artificial intelligence (AI) over the next decade and beyond . Amazon also continues to enter new markets, most recently launching the first of its Project Kuiper satellites that will provide high-speed internet across the world .  Meta remains a cash cow . Its apps reach 3.43 billion active users every day -- nearly 42% of the world population . The company is also making solid progress with its smart glasses development .  The Trade Desk's shares have been absolutely clobbered this year, plunging more than 50% . The adtech leader reported lower-than-expected revenue in its fourth-quarter results . I think this stock could be a big winner for investors who buy shares while they're down 30% from the previous high .  Vertex Pharmaceuticals' share price hasn't declined in 2025 . The biotech stock has skyrocketed 26% year to date . The company has three new products on the market . I expect all three of these drugs to become huge blockbusters for Vertex .  Investors who buy Vertex Pharmaceuticals stock in May and "go away" for 10 years will enjoy market-beating returns . Nvidia's valuation is trading near a three-year low and looks increasingly attractive . Fears regarding U.S. trade restrictions and a perceived slowing in AI spending have the stock trading lower . Nvidia stock is down roughly 25% from its peak .  The demand for data centers and servers with the computational horsepower needed for AI fueled a big run-up in capex spending by big tech . This spending helped fuel massive sales increases for Nvidia, as its data center segment generated six consecutive quarters of triple-digit year-over-year growth . But numerous reports suggested that some of Nvidia's biggest customers were scaling back on data center spending, which sent the stock plunging .  CEO Satya Nadella downplayed the reports of a slowdown in data center spending . Nadeva: "We continue to see very strong demand, and we're looking both in the next couple of years as well as long term and seeing the numbers only going up"  As the leading provider of GPUs used to power AI in data centers, Nvidia is poised to benefit from the ongoing data center build-out . This will support the ongoing and accelerating adoption of AI .  The tariff situation remains a wild card and is subject to change from day to day . Some investors are still wary of the future adoption of AI and how it will impact the company's future growth . However, for investors with a long-term outlook, Nvidia looks increasingly compelling .
